AD_ParentsReact.synopsis: The scene with Kagha has just ended. Marrick has either stabbed Kagha to death, or was convinced to back down by the player.

AD_GuardAndGoblin001.synopsis: Goblin 005 is bothering goblin 1 and bullying them because they're not doing anything. Goblin 001 doesn't let it get to them and retorts with some smart jabs. They quite dislike each other.

AD_Lover1_Lover2.synopsis: Danis and Bex are sitting together as a party dies down - tipsy, content, and feeling safe and happy for the first time in a while.

AD_Prodigies.synopsis: Rolan is doing magic tricks with prestidigitation. Rolan, Cal and Lia are teasing each other and enjoying the banter.Rolan is standing. Lia and cal are sitting.

AD_ZevlorReflections.synopsis: Zevlor is on his own during the camp celebration. He's standing, gazing out at the party and quietly reflecting to himself.

AD_WorshipInterruption.synopsis: The goblins are reciting a prayer to their god.

AD_Backup05_Backup06.synopsis: Both Rhy and Kivak are in good spirits, having a fun and friendly conversation during a party.This AD takes place during a party thrown in the player's camp, celebrating the goblin's defeat.

AD_Bard_Flirty.synopsis: This is a warm and flirtatious back and forth between Alfira and Lakrissa. They learn about themselves, and quickly realise how much they enjoy the others company.

AD_Bard_Backup02.synopsis: Alfira and Zae banter together. Zae is very very drunk and up on her feets dancing whereas Alfira is watching her - bemused.

AD_CorpseLooter006Solo.synopsis: Solo AD played when one of the corpse looters loots the corpses.

AD_CorpseLooter007Solo.synopsis: Solo AD played when one of the corpse looters loots the corpses.

AD_CorpseLooter003Solo.synopsis: Solo AD played when one of the corpse looters loots the corpses.

AD_Irritated_Backup06.synopsis: Both Guex and Kivak are in good spirits, having a fun and friendly conversation during a party.This AD takes place during a party thrown in the player's camp, celebrating the goblin's defeat.

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef.synopsis: In this AD Ikaron is a bit sullen/judgmental at first, but loosens up a bit if the player gets him to drink in his separate dialogue. Guex is in good spirits throughout.Guex and Ikaron are conversing during a party thrown in the player's camp. The player has just defeated the goblins that threatened to kill the Tieflings.

AD_CorpseLooters.synopsis: Goblin 003-006-007 are looting a pile of tiefling corpses, hoping to find some shinies.

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader.synopsis: Locke and Marricko confront Kagha - the person responsible for the death of their daughter. In the first scenarion, Kagha is sincerely remorseful for her actions. She begs for forgiveness.In the second, she is cold and unrepentant. She thinks the parents are all bluster and will not harm her (spoiler - she's very wrong.)

AD_ReportingToDrow.synopsis: One of the goblin guards is reporting to Minthara.

AD_GoblinWorship.synopsis: PartyGoblin_009 is in charge of the altar being built to celebrate the raid. Prays to the absolute.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05.synopsis:
In AD, Ikaron is initially dour and judgmental; if the player convinces him to have a drink in his separate dialogue, he opens up a bit. Rhy maintains his upbeat spirit the whole time.
Ikaron and Rhy are conversing during a party thrown in the player's camp. The player has just defeated the goblins that threatened to kill the Tieflings.

AD_Flirty_Backup_01.synopsis: Chell is pretty drunk and happily chatting (more like roaring) about all the monsters and evil creatures she'd beat up. Lakrissa is playing along and finds Chell hilarious.

AD_Backup01_Backup02.synopsis: All Zae wants to do is dance whereas Chell is pretty drunk and cheerfully yelling about fighting everyone. Chaos ensues.

AD_GoblinGuardComplaint.synopsis: PartyGoblin_004 patrols and guards the beach area of the camp. Takes their job seriously but is displeased. ADs plays when they are alone on the beach.

AD_ParentsAlone.synopsis: Tiefling parents are alone on the beach. Their daughter is dead. In the first scenario Kagha is also dead but at the players hand. In the second, they murdered her.

AD_ParentsReact_1.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsReact_1.context: NodeContext: Gentle and loving - tinged with shock at what you've just seen

AD_ParentsReact_0.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsReact_0.text: No. But the snake is dead. That's all that matters.

AD_ParentsReact_2.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsReact_2.text: That was a hard thing to do.

AD_ParentsReact_3.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsReact_3.text: Here's hoping I don't regret it.
AD_ParentsReact_3.context: NodeContext: Sighing - feeling drained as your grief sets in

AD_GuardAndGoblin001_2.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_GuardAndGoblin001_2.text: You're still sittin' there? You're not even doin' anythin'.

AD_GuardAndGoblin001_7.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_GuardAndGoblin001_7.text: I told ya to get up. You're disrespectin' the True Souls.

AD_GuardAndGoblin001_3.speaker: Goblin Brawler
AD_GuardAndGoblin001_3.text: You know they're probably going to appoint a new True Soul after this?

AD_GuardAndGoblin001_10.speaker: Goblin Brawler
AD_GuardAndGoblin001_10.text: I'm just sayin', be careful who you go around annoyin'.

AD_GuardAndGoblin001_9.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_GuardAndGoblin001_9.text: I am. Got nothin' to fear from you.

AD_GuardAndGoblin001_13.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_GuardAndGoblin001_13.text: Look who's here, sittin' all by himself.

AD_GuardAndGoblin001_5.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_GuardAndGoblin001_5.text: You know you'll never get stronger by just standin' around.

AD_GuardAndGoblin001_1.speaker: Goblin Brawler
AD_GuardAndGoblin001_1.text: Well then, ain't it time you start moving again?

AD_GuardAndGoblin001_14.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_GuardAndGoblin001_14.text: Heh. We'll see which one of us ends up on top.

AD_Lover1_Lover2_8.speaker: Danis
AD_Lover1_Lover2_8.text: Maybe we should forget the city - live out here under the stars.

AD_Lover1_Lover2_16.speaker: Bex
AD_Lover1_Lover2_16.text: It's a bed and a roof for me. But off you go, master ranger.

AD_Lover1_Lover2_14.speaker: Bex
AD_Lover1_Lover2_14.text: We should go down and see the water.

AD_Lover1_Lover2_1.speaker: Danis
AD_Lover1_Lover2_1.text: What for? It's all dark and muddy.

AD_Lover1_Lover2_15.speaker: Danis
AD_Lover1_Lover2_15.text: You recall how I love you very dearly?

AD_Lover1_Lover2_12.speaker: Danis
AD_Lover1_Lover2_12.text: Are you planning to share the last of that wine?

AD_Prodigies_1.speaker: Lia
AD_Prodigies_1.context: NodeContext: Excited - calling out for rolan to 'make' things out of magic

AD_Prodigies_7.speaker: Cal
AD_Prodigies_7.context: NodeContext: Excited - calling out for rolan to 'make' things out of magic

AD_Prodigies_0.speaker: Rolan
AD_Prodigies_0.text: Toddlers are easier to please than you lot.
AD_Prodigies_0.context: NodeContext: Laughing - pleased at the attention

AD_Prodigies_4.speaker: Lia
AD_Prodigies_4.text: Try not to get too close, Cal.

AD_Prodigies_3.speaker: Rolan
AD_Prodigies_3.text: Yes. Remember what happened last time?

AD_Prodigies_5.speaker: Cal
AD_Prodigies_5.text: I was eight and you magicked up a kitten. How was I supposed to know it was made of fire?
AD_Prodigies_5.context: NodeContext: Pretending to be grumpy but enjoying yourself

AD_Prodigies_6.speaker: Cal
AD_Prodigies_6.text: The moment we hit the city, let's look for our own place!

AD_Prodigies_2.speaker: Lia
AD_Prodigies_2.text: Rolan can finally have his own sock drawer - folded, colour-coordinated, even ironed.

AD_Prodigies_8.speaker: Rolan
AD_Prodigies_8.text: There's nothing more satisfying than a well-organised wardrobe.
AD_Prodigies_8.context: NodeContext: hint of a smile. Teasing.

AD_ZevlorReflections_0.speaker: Zevlor
AD_ZevlorReflections_0.text: Is this everyone? Our numbers have grown so few...
AD_ZevlorReflections_0.context: NodeContext: Apart and looking out at revellers, slightly sad

AD_ZevlorReflections_1.speaker: Zevlor
AD_ZevlorReflections_1.text: No. Let them have fun. I'll be ruining it come morning anyway.

AD_ZevlorReflections_2.speaker: Zevlor
AD_ZevlorReflections_2.text: I should be out there, talking with them. In... just a moment, maybe.
AD_ZevlorReflections_2.context: NodeContext: Quietly gathering himself to go out and socialise with people.

AD_ZevlorReflections_3.speaker: Zevlor
AD_ZevlorReflections_3.text: No more. I can't afford to lose any more of them.
AD_ZevlorReflections_3.context: NodeContext: Making a quiet promise to himself not to let any more of his people die

AD_WorshipInterruption_0.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_WorshipInterruption_0.text: Inspire us even more - so we can show your strength!

AD_WorshipInterruption_2.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_WorshipInterruption_2.context: NodeContext: Prosit! / Hallelujah! - An enthusiastic toast often spoken as a call and response. Pronounced rawl-TOOSH! (Long oo, like soon, not like foot.)

AD_WorshipInterruption_7.speaker: Goblin Brawler
AD_WorshipInterruption_7.context: NodeContext: This is a kind of toast. Pronounched TOOSH! (Long oo, like soon, not like foot.)

AD_Backup05_Backup06_2.speaker: Kivak
AD_Backup05_Backup06_2.text: How much ale you figure we have left?

AD_Backup05_Backup06_7.speaker: Rhy
AD_Backup05_Backup06_7.text: Gods, it's good to be out of that damned grove!

AD_Backup05_Backup06_6.speaker: Kivak
AD_Backup05_Backup06_6.text: This, though! Night sky, warm fire...
AD_Backup05_Backup06_6.context: NodeContext: He's rather sentimental about nature

AD_Backup05_Backup06_1.speaker: Rhy
AD_Backup05_Backup06_1.context: NodeContext: Prefers the city over nature

AD_Backup05_Backup06_8.speaker: Kivak
AD_Backup05_Backup06_8.text: What're you going to do in Baldur's Gate when we get there?

AD_Backup05_Backup06_10.speaker: Kivak
AD_Backup05_Backup06_10.text: Never thought things would end up this way.

AD_Backup05_Backup06_4.speaker: Rhy
AD_Backup05_Backup06_4.text: Chin up! This is a celebration!
AD_Backup05_Backup06_4.context: NodeContext: Trying to cheer up his friend

AD_Backup05_Backup06_9.speaker: Kivak
AD_Backup05_Backup06_9.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced at first, but enthusiastic after the ellipses

AD_Bard_Flirty_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_1.text: How about... 'two tiefling queens, frightful and fierce.'
AD_Bard_Flirty_1.context: NodeContext: Grinning as you get into the joking and flirting. Having fun.

AD_Bard_Flirty_7.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_7.text: That's more like it! How many goblins did we kill? Ten?
AD_Bard_Flirty_7.context: NodeContext: Big smile and gesture of approval. Encouraging her.

AD_Bard_Flirty_12.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_12.context: NodeContext: A cheeky grin as you lean in, having fun

AD_Bard_Flirty_14.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_14.context: NodeContext: Laughter, perhaps clap you hands in delight

AD_Bard_Flirty_6.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_6.text: You got friends or family in the city?

AD_Bard_Flirty_23.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_23.text: A sister. She's got two boys - the sweetest things you've ever seen.

AD_Bard_Flirty_0.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_0.text: I can introduce you all, if you want?
AD_Bard_Flirty_0.context: NodeContext: Love and warmth in your voice as you brighten up at the mention of your nephews

AD_Bard_Flirty_17.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_17.context: NodeContext: Love and warmth in your voice

AD_Bard_Flirty_11.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_11.text: What are you going to do in the city?

AD_Bard_Flirty_24.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_24.text: Eh, there's always work for a guard. You?
AD_Bard_Flirty_24.context: NodeContext: 'EH' comes with a shrug, you haven't really thought of it.

AD_Bard_Flirty_25.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_25.text: I've always wanted to sing at the Elfsong Tavern.
AD_Bard_Flirty_25.context: NodeContext: A little hesitant - you're afraid somewhere as prestigous as the Elfsong Tavern would never take you

AD_Bard_Flirty_9.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_9.text: If the owner has any sense, they'll hire you on the spot.
AD_Bard_Flirty_9.context: NodeContext: Smiling and confident - you mean every word you say. You really admire Alfira.

AD_Bard_Flirty_18.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_18.context: NodeContext: Teasing and flirtatious. Your friend is composing a song about the tiefling's exploits.

AD_Bard_Flirty_15.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_15.text: All right, erm, 'hearts aquiver, we raised our bows...'
AD_Bard_Flirty_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding your lute in your hands - not playing it. NodeContext: Having fun but a little hesitant as you try to come up with something. Not sung, just repeated like a poem

AD_Bard_Flirty_10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_10.text: Pfft, none of that poetic stuff! Something like...
AD_Bard_Flirty_10.context: NodeContext: Teasing and laughing as you wave the suggestion away

AD_Bard_Flirty_26.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_26.text: 'Goblins swarmed, but we were brave and fried them all with a Thunder Wave!'
AD_Bard_Flirty_26.context: NodeContext: Big dramatic voice as you recite your 'poetry'

AD_Bard_Flirty_5.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_5.context: NodeContext: Laughing a little at your friend being ridiculous

AD_Bard_Flirty_20.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_20.text: What's your plan for the city?

AD_Bard_Flirty_22.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_22.context: NodeContext: The player has convinced you to quit being a bard. You feel lost and directionless.

AD_Bard_Flirty_13.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_13.text: Don't worry. I can get us both jobs as guards. If you practice.
AD_Bard_Flirty_13.context: NodeContext: Said with a shrug, like it's no big deal. You actually care deeply for Alfira but are trying to play it cool.

AD_Bard_Flirty_21.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting up, looking at Alfira and gesturing to your own faceNodeContext: Playful and teasing

AD_Bard_Flirty_16.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_16.text: All right. *ahem* What - what you looking at?
AD_Bard_Flirty_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Try to square your shoulders and look intimidating (spoiler, you don't)NodeContext: Nervous, after you 'cough' your 'what - what are you looking at' should sound comically agressive. You stumble on the words and maybe drop your voice lower, or something? An unconvincing performance either way.

AD_Bard_Flirty_8.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_8.text: Aha! Only a child would find that intimidating.
AD_Bard_Flirty_8.context: NodeContext: You burst out laughing at your friend's attempt at a 'glare' - she did a terrible job

AD_Bard_Flirty_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Flirty_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Crossing your arms and looking awayNodeContext: You're embarassed.

AD_Bard_Flirty_2.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Bard_Flirty_2.text: Hey, don't talk like that. We'll work on it.
AD_Bard_Flirty_2.context: NodeContext: Familiar and more gentle - you like teasing your friend but don't want to upset her

AD_Bard_Backup02_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Backup02_3.text: I told you - I quit music.

AD_Bard_Backup02_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Backup02_1.text: No jig I know could keep up with you.

AD_Bard_Backup02_7.speaker: Zae
AD_Bard_Backup02_7.context: NodeContext: Drunk girl at 2 am trying to get her sober friend to dance

AD_Bard_Backup02_2.speaker: Zae
AD_Bard_Backup02_2.context: NodeContext: Drunk girl at 2 am trying to get her sober friend to dance

AD_Bard_Backup02_9.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Backup02_9.text: I'll need more wine for that.

AD_Bard_Backup02_8.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Backup02_8.text: Do you ever get tired, Zae?

AD_Bard_Backup02_4.speaker: Zae
AD_Bard_Backup02_4.context: NodeContext: Half shouted - you're having a blast

AD_Bard_Backup02_5.speaker: Alfira
AD_Bard_Backup02_5.text: Hah! Let's see how you are in the morning.

AD_CorpseLooter007Solo_0.speaker: Goblin Devout
AD_CorpseLooter007Solo_0.text: Just imagine what these skulls are gonna look like.

AD_CorpseLooter007Solo_1.speaker: Goblin Devout
AD_CorpseLooter007Solo_1.text: D'ya think we can make their heads into helmets?

AD_CorpseLooter003Solo_0.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooter003Solo_0.text: Ack. This one's already starting to rot.

AD_CorpseLooter003Solo_2.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooter003Solo_2.text: Her eye is all gone, yuck.

AD_Irritated_Backup06_0.speaker: Kivak
AD_Irritated_Backup06_0.text: I feel like I can breathe for the first time in months.
AD_Irritated_Backup06_0.context: NodeContext: He can finally relax, the goblins are no longer a threat.

AD_Irritated_Backup06_3.speaker: Kivak
AD_Irritated_Backup06_3.context: NodeContext: He's referring to the tieflings who didn't make it out alive.

AD_Irritated_Backup06_5.speaker: Kivak
AD_Irritated_Backup06_5.text: I can't lie - I'm going to miss this place a bit.
AD_Irritated_Backup06_5.context: NodeContext: Speaking of the druid grove.

AD_Irritated_Backup06_2.speaker: Guex
AD_Irritated_Backup06_2.text: One sight of the city, and you'll forget all about it.

AD_Irritated_Backup06_7.speaker: Kivak
AD_Irritated_Backup06_7.context: NodeContext: 'I thought you'd never been to the city.'

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_0.speaker: Guex
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_0.text: You'll have a drink, but not with me? Betrayal.

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_10.speaker: Guex
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_10.text: Bah! Nothing another ale won't fix!

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_9.speaker: Guex
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_9.text: Are you weaving, or is it me?

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_1.speaker: Ikaron
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_1.text: Maybe you should drink some water.

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_2.speaker: Guex
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_2.text: I'm fine. One more, that's all.

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_14.speaker: Guex
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_14.text: There's an animal hiding in that shell, I bet.

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_11.speaker: Ikaron
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_11.text: I don't know what that means.

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_13.speaker: Guex
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_13.text: Have another drink and you'll know exactly what I mean.

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_16.speaker: Guex
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_16.text: Your mug's as sour as this ale. We're supposed to be celebratin'!

AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_3.speaker: Ikaron
AD_Irritated_SonOfChef_3.text: Well go bother someone else then.

AD_CorpseLooters_1.speaker: Goblin Devout
AD_CorpseLooters_1.text: Did the others really have to use so much blood for the altar?
AD_CorpseLooters_1.context: NodeContext: Disappointed all the blood is gone.

AD_CorpseLooters_14.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_14.context: NodeContext: Disappointed all the blood is gone.

AD_CorpseLooters_12.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_12.text: Nah, but they'll make a nice, big bonfire.
AD_CorpseLooters_12.context: NodeContext: looking forward to making a bonfire out of the corpses.

AD_CorpseLooters_2.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_2.context: NodeContext: Saw another goblin put something away.

AD_CorpseLooters_4.speaker: Goblin Devout
AD_CorpseLooters_4.context: NodeContext: Trying to hide what he got from the corpses.

AD_CorpseLooters_9.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_9.text: C'mon, show me. I just wanna look.
AD_CorpseLooters_9.context: NodeContext: Wants to see what another goblin got from the corpses (and steal it)

AD_CorpseLooters_7.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_7.text: Yeah, right. I've heard that before.
AD_CorpseLooters_7.context: NodeContext: reacting to a cliptomaniac that said he just wanted to look.

AD_CorpseLooters_3.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_3.context: NodeContext: annoyed, the other goblin is trying to take his corpse, claiming it's his.

AD_CorpseLooters_0.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_0.text: It's red. The one I killed was red.

AD_CorpseLooters_8.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_8.text: That's just blood. This one's clearly pink.
AD_CorpseLooters_8.context: NodeContext: annoyed, the other goblin is trying to take his corpse, claiming it's his.

AD_CorpseLooters_13.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_13.text: You're just jealous 'cause I found somethin'.
AD_CorpseLooters_13.context: NodeContext: annoyed, the other goblin is trying to take his corpse, claiming it's his.

AD_CorpseLooters_10.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_10.context: NodeContext: Found something in the corpses.

AD_CorpseLooters_6.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_CorpseLooters_6.context: NodeContext: already looking forward to stealing it.

AD_CorpseLooters_11.speaker: Goblin Devout
AD_CorpseLooters_11.context: NodeContext: Was told it was a golden tooth, but he doesn't believe it.

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_1.speaker: Kagha
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_1.text: Then you should have kept her in line. You've only yourselves to blame.

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_13.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_13.text: Hah. You have no idea what's about to happen - do you?
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_13.context: NodeContext: a sharp cruel laugh - you've poisned Kagha's wine, but she doesn't know it yet

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_5.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_5.context: NodeContext: Fury and horror - how could this woman not regret killing your child?

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_4.speaker: Kagha
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_4.text: A terrible tragedy. I am so very sorry.

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_0.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_0.text: You will be once I'm done with you.

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_7.speaker: Kagha
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_7.text: I swear to you, I gave Teela no order to strike.

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_12.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_12.text: Our daughter is dead because of you!

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_8.speaker: Kagha
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_8.text: Please, just leave me in peace.

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_9.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_9.text: Or what? You'll kill me? Tell your snakes to rip out my throat?

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_10.speaker: Kagha
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_10.text: You loosed a thug in my grove. What did you expect to happen?

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_2.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_2.context: NodeContext: Fury and horror - how could this woman not regret killing your child?

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_14.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_14.text: Did you think we'd let you go? Let you walk away?

AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_15.speaker: Kagha
AD_ParentsAndDruidLeader_15.text: You're trying my patience. Get out of my sight.

AD_ReportingToDrow_1.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_ReportingToDrow_1.text: Nothin' but the bird, True Soul.

AD_ReportingToDrow_4.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_ReportingToDrow_4.text: Looks like the altar will be finished soon.

AD_ReportingToDrow_5.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_ReportingToDrow_5.text: Skies are all clear. The water is, too.

AD_ReportingToDrow_7.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_ReportingToDrow_7.text: Nothin' to report, madame True Soul.

AD_ReportingToDrow_3.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_ReportingToDrow_3.context: NodeContext: Got told off when he thought he was doing a good job, but is too nervous too complain about it, becuase he might die if he does.

AD_GoblinWorship_1.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_GoblinWorship_1.text: By blood and brand, the Absolute conquers!

AD_GoblinWorship_2.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_GoblinWorship_2.text: One body, one flesh! One world without end!

AD_GoblinWorship_3.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_GoblinWorship_3.text: Our minds are open. Our minds are pure.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_17.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_17.context: NodeContext: In a shaking-his-head, slightly embarassed way

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_7.speaker: Rhy
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_7.context: NodeContext: Says 'here to us' in a loud whisper.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_4.speaker: Rhy
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_4.text: Could be ale's just not your drink.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_20.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_20.text: No wine! The ale was more than enough.
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_20.context: NodeContext: Shouts 'no wine' to whoever might be getting him wine. The rest is addressed to Rhy.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_5.speaker: Rhy
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_5.text: Your cheeks are looking a bit pinker than usual.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_12.speaker: Rhy
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_12.text: All it took was one! I'm jealous.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_9.speaker: Rhy
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_9.text: Did I see you drinking ale?

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_13.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_13.text: And no, I don't want another.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_10.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_10.text: How many of those have you had?

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_11.speaker: Rhy
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_11.text: You could stand to relax a bit, mate.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_14.speaker: Rhy
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_14.text: I see the problem - you don't have a drink!

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_3.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_3.text: I'd rather keep my wits about me, thanks.

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_18.speaker: Rhy
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_18.text: Don't you think we owe the dead a pint or two?

AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_0.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_Backup05_0.text: I think you just want an excuse to drink.

AD_Flirty_Backup_01_2.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Flirty_Backup_01_2.text: And what other evil creatures have you vanquished?

AD_Flirty_Backup_01_8.speaker: Chell
AD_Flirty_Backup_01_8.text: I fought a goblin once. A big one.

AD_Flirty_Backup_01_4.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Flirty_Backup_01_4.text: Heh. Yes. You told me - in great detail.

AD_Flirty_Backup_01_3.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Flirty_Backup_01_3.text: Have you ever fought a goblin before?

AD_Flirty_Backup_01_0.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Flirty_Backup_01_0.text: Uh-huh. So the last one you took down... what was their name?

AD_Flirty_Backup_01_6.speaker: Chell
AD_Flirty_Backup_01_6.text: Wish I could've kicked that goblin king in the head.

AD_Backup01_Backup02_3.speaker: Chell
AD_Backup01_Backup02_3.text: It doesn't matter how many times you ask.

AD_Backup01_Backup02_8.speaker: Zae
AD_Backup01_Backup02_8.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully and drunkenly roaring for a dance

AD_Backup01_Backup02_5.speaker: Zae
AD_Backup01_Backup02_5.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully and drunkenly roaring for a dance. Lots of hand waving and gestruing.

AD_Backup01_Backup02_4.speaker: Zae
AD_Backup01_Backup02_4.context: NodeContext: Said very loudly and dramatically as you throw your hands in the air

AD_Backup01_Backup02_7.speaker: Zae
AD_Backup01_Backup02_7.context: NodeContext: You're drunk - standing up and trying to encourage your friend to dance.Gesturing them to come on and dance.

AD_Backup01_Backup02_1.speaker: Zae
AD_Backup01_Backup02_1.context: NodeContext: Said very loudly and dramatically as you throw hands in the air

AD_GoblinGuardComplaint_0.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_GoblinGuardComplaint_0.text: What do they think's gonna happen? A merfolk ambush?

AD_GoblinGuardComplaint_3.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_GoblinGuardComplaint_3.text: I was part of the raid too. Ain't fair.

AD_ParentsAlone_0.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAlone_0.text: I want to see her. So much.
AD_ParentsAlone_0.context: NodeContext: Upset - but holding it back

AD_ParentsAlone_12.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_12.context: NodeContext: a heavy sigh as you think of Arabella's smile

AD_ParentsAlone_7.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_7.text: It doesn't feel right - going to Baldur's Gate without our little girl.
AD_ParentsAlone_7.context: NodeContext: A catch in your chest - arabella always wanted to see the city

AD_ParentsAlone_18.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_18.text: She was so looking forward to the city.
AD_ParentsAlone_18.context: NodeContext: A catch in your chest - arabella always wanted to see the city

AD_ParentsAlone_17.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAlone_17.text: Yes, she hated being in the grove.

AD_ParentsAlone_14.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_14.text: I wonder if she knew something was going to happen to her?

AD_ParentsAlone_8.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_8.text: I thought killing that snake would make it hurt less.
AD_ParentsAlone_8.context: NodeContext: Upset, griefing - thinking of your daughter

AD_ParentsAlone_10.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_10.text: I just miss Arabella more. Why? Why did she have to die?
AD_ParentsAlone_10.context: NodeContext: Upset, griefing - thinking of your daughter

AD_ParentsAlone_2.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAlone_2.context: NodeContext: A little lost - you want to help your wife but you don't know how

AD_ParentsAlone_4.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAlone_4.text: But Arabella saw justice. Because of you.
AD_ParentsAlone_4.context: NodeContext: Pride and love in your voice

AD_ParentsAlone_9.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_9.text: You think Arabella is scared - wherever she is?
AD_ParentsAlone_9.context: NodeContext: Grieving - your daughter is dead but you hope she's happy

AD_ParentsAlone_1.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAlone_1.text: I think she's probably pickpocketed half of the Fugue Plane and is having a blast.
AD_ParentsAlone_1.context: NodeContext: Smiling sadly as you think of your mischievious daughter

AD_ParentsAlone_20.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_20.text: Hah. I bet Kelemvor is fit to strangle her.
AD_ParentsAlone_20.context: NodeContext: Smiling sadly as you think of your mischievious daughter

AD_ParentsAlone_11.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAlone_11.context: NodeContext: Your wife just murdered your child's killer. Gently and soothing.

AD_ParentsAlone_13.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_13.text: I'm not fine. Not one bit.

AD_ParentsAlone_15.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_15.text: I killed someone, Locke. I stabbed them to death.
AD_ParentsAlone_15.context: NodeContext: Mounting horror at what you've done

AD_ParentsAlone_5.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAlone_5.text: And I don't feel bad. You must think I'm a monster.

AD_ParentsAlone_21.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAlone_21.text: No. I'm proud of you. I know Arabella would be too.
AD_ParentsAlone_21.context: NodeContext: This is sincere and genuine

AD_ParentsAlone_22.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAlone_22.text: You two fought noon and night, but there's no one she looked up to more.
AD_ParentsAlone_22.context: NodeContext: A slight smile as you think of your daughter and wife's fights
